response_text: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="iso-8859-1"?><rss version="2.0"><channel><title>The Telegraph - Calcutta | Sports - Sports</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com</link><description>The Telegraph - Calcutta | Sports</description><language>en-us</language><pubDate>Sat, May 14, 2016</pubDate><lastBuildDate>Fri, May 13, 2016 04:15:26 AM IST</lastBuildDate><generator>The Telegraph Webdesk</generator><managingEditor>ttfeedback@abpmail.com</managingEditor><webMaster>ttfeedback@abpmail.com</webMaster><category>Sports</category><copyright>Copyright (C) 2016, The Telegraph. All rights reserved.</copyright><image><title>The Telegraph: Calcutta</title><url>http://www.telegraphindia.com/images/logo_small.gif</url><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com</link></image><item><title>Smart Manohar is back as the chairman of ICC</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85413.jsp</link><description>It's time once again for currying favour in the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI).</description></item><item><title>Need to improve a lot before Roland Garros, says Roger</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85411.jsp</link><description>Roger Federer said 'time was ticking' in his battle to recover form and fitness for the French Open after losing to rising Austrian Dominic Thiem 7-6 (2), 6-4 in the third round of the Italian Open on Thursday.</description></item><item><title>Sushil may move court</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85412.jsp</link><description>The issue of selection of wrestler Sushil Kumar for the Rio Olympics could end up in court, after the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) president Brijbhushan Sharan Singh said it would be difficult to hold trials now.</description></item><item><title>President’s post done away with</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85403.jsp</link><description>The International Cricket Council (ICC) has abolished the post of president, according to a statement released by it on Thursday.</description></item><item><title>Ranty: Time to leave EB</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85422.jsp</link><description>Ranty Martins will not be playing for East Bengal anymore, even if there is an offer to extend his contract. The Nigerian, whose contract with East Bengal will end on May 31 said, he will not continue with the city club even if he got an offer.</description></item><item><title>Vijender ready for Soldra</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85421.jsp</link><description>Unstoppable so far, Indian boxing star Vijender Singh will take on Poland's Andrzej Soldra in his first eight-round professional contest here on Friday.</description></item><item><title>AIFF meet to discuss merger</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85420.jsp</link><description>The All India Football Federation (AIFF) is set to kick off its much-awaited merger of the I-League and ISL, when they hold a meeting of the clubs and franchises, here next Tuesday.</description></item><item><title>Sunderland manage to beat drop</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85423.jsp</link><description>Christian Benteke headed home from close range as Liverpool grabbed a stoppage-time leveller to snatch a point against Chelsea in a 1-1 draw on Wednesday after Eden Hazard’s dazzling opener for the visitors. </description></item><item><title>Rosberg happy to do extra homework</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85416.jsp</link><description>Savvy student Nico Rosberg is happy to do the extra technical homework required as he has roared to the top of this year's drivers' world championship with a run of four straight wins.</description></item><item><title>My demotion to Toro RossoWas shocking: Daniil Kvyat</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85415.jsp</link><description>Daniil Kvyat revealed on Thursday that Red Bull rang to tell him he had lost his seat at the Formula One team just as he was settling down to watch an episode of Game of Thrones.</description></item><item><title>Beckham bullishon Kane and Alli</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85414.jsp</link><description>The burgeoning Tottenham Hotspur partnership between Harry Kane and Dele Alli could lead England to the later stages of the European Championship next month, according to former national team captain David Beckham.</description></item><item><title>Eden is captain: Marc</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85419.jsp</link><description>Belgium will deploy Manchester City's Kevin de Bruyne as a playmaker behind two strikers at next month's European Championship, said coach Marc Wilmots after naming a preliminary 24-man squad on Thursday.</description></item><item><title>MI are firm favourites vs Kings XI</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85402.jsp</link><description> Having regrouped quickly after suffering an 85-run drubbing at the hands of the Sunrisers Hyderabad, the Mumbai Indians will look to continue their winning ways when they lock horns with laggards Kings XI Punjab in the IPL IX here on Friday.</description></item><item><title>Gayle will fire: Rahul</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85410.jsp</link><description>Royal Challengers Bangalore's Lokesh Rahul, who top-scored in a losing cause in their previous IPL game, said Mumbai Indians benefitted as the pitch at the Chinnaswamy here had eased out in the second half.</description></item><item><title>Kusal Perera: Knew I would be cleared</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85408.jsp</link><description>Sri Lankan wicketkeeper-batsman Kusal Perera targeted a swift return to international cricket after officials admitted the analysis of a doping test, which triggered his suspension, had been botched.</description></item><item><title>India keen on D/N Test: CA</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85407.jsp</link><description>James Sutherland has said that the BCCI has approached the Cricket Australia (CA) to play a Day/Night Test when the team from Down Under tours India early next year.</description></item><item><title>All the best, says Sourav</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85406.jsp</link><description>Sourav Ganguly, the Cricket Association of Bengal president, wished good luck to the first independent chairman of the ICC - Shashank Manohar.</description></item><item><title>Katich: We need to be cautious</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85405.jsp</link><description>Slipping to the third spot after their loss to the Gujarat Lions, the Kolkata Knight Riders have to win at least two of their remaining four matches in order to make the play-offs.</description></item><item><title>Easy win for DareDevils</title><link>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160514/jsp/sports/story_85404.jsp</link><description>The Delhi DareDevils produced an all-round effort to defeat the Sunrisers Hyderabad by seven wickets to move up to third in the IPL table here at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium on Thursday.</description></item></channel></rss>
